main event: On October 8, 1955, at 2330Z, a round and solid silver or white unidentified flying object was reported in Loogootee, Indiana. It was observed moving at a speed of over 1000 mph, making no sound, with a length of observation unknown.
interesting points: The object was described as traveling at a speed of 1000 mph and making no sound, indicating advanced capabilities.
The object appeared to be approximately round and solid, with a silver or white color, defying conventional aircraft characteristics.
The observation took place in clear conditions with 100% cloudless sky and unlimited visibility, allowing for a detailed sighting.
An additional observer, located six miles east of the main observer, reported observing a comparable object at around the same time, adding credibility to the sighting.
The main observer, an employee of the U.S. Naval Ammunition Depot, was considered reliable, enhancing the credibility of the report.
sighted object: round and solid silver or white unidentified flying object
witnesses: reliable eyewitnesses from U.S. Naval Ammunition Depot
photographs: no photographs available in the report
